inclusion.criterion: term infants > 37 weeks gestation in the Level I nursery receiving lactation support and identified by lactation as having a newborn component to feeding dysfunction, who must be available for at least two inpatient treatment sessions and whose parent has provided informed consent
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: All breastfed mother-infant dyads are offered evaluation by a lactation consultant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Breastfeeding sessions are routinely scored by either registered nurses or lactation consultants using the LATCH tool, with scores entered into a flowsheet on the electronic medical record
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Eligible infants are enrolled in the study by a lactation consultant, who then notifies an on-call physician
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The infant's mother is provided with a brochure explaining OMT and outlining potential benefits in newborns
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The on-call physician provides informed consent and performs either the OMT or sham protocol
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Infants are enrolled Monday through Thursday, and treatments are performed Monday through Friday
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Enrolled infants are added to a password-protected, numerical list and randomized into their group based upon whether they land on an even number (sham) or an odd number (OMT)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Group assignments are blinded to the parents, nursing staff, and lactation consultants
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A brief note acknowledging that the infant has been enrolled in the study is entered into the electronic medical record
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The OMT/sham treatments are documented on paper; kept in a locked document folder in the residency teaching clinic; and scanned into the electronic medical record two weeks after discharge
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Infants in the control arm receive 'sham' OMT during which they receive a gentle application of light touch but no treatment
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Level II or III nursery status
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has Paget's Disease of Bone, which is a contraindication for the study. The patient's symptoms and examination findings are consistent with Paget's Disease.
